definitions: The act of combining two or more parts, elements, or ingredients to form a whole.
The act of making something worse or more intense, especially a problem or difficulty.
The act of calculating or adding interest on both the initial principal and the accumulated interest from previous periods.
The act of agreeing to abstain from prosecuting a felon in return for a consideration.
examples: The chemist was compounding the new solution.
His lies were compounding the initial error.
The bank was compounding interest daily.
The lawyer was accused of compounding a felony.
